definition: the occupation of athletes who compete for pay, play boisterously
details:
noun
- the occupation of athletes who compete for pay
- an active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition
= synonyms: athletics
- verbal wit or mockery (often at another's expense but not to be taken seriously)
= synonyms: play
- (biology) an organism that has characteristics resulting from chromosomal alteration
= synonyms: mutant
- someone who engages in sports
= synonyms: sportsman, sportswoman
- a person known for the way she (or he) behaves when teased or defeated or subjected to trying circumstances
= example: a person known for the way she (or he) behaves when teased or defeated or subjected to trying circumstances
- (Maine colloquial) a temporary summer resident of Maine
= synonyms: summercater
verb
- play boisterously
= synonyms: lark
- wear or display in an ostentatious or proud manner
= example: wear or display in an ostentatious or proud manner
= synonyms: feature, boast
